stockgeist.client module¶

class stockgeist.client.StockGeistClient(token)[source]¶

Bases: object

A Client class responsible for communication with StockGeist’s API.

get_article_metrics(symbol: str, timeframe: str = '5m', filter: Tuple[str, ...] = ('titles'), start: Optional[str] = None, end: Optional[str] = None) → stockgeist.responses.ArticleMetricsResponse[source]¶

Queries StockGeist’s API and gets article metrics data.

Parameters

  • symbol – Stock ticker for which to retrieve data.

  • timeframe – Time resolution of returned data. Possible values are 5m, 1h, 1d.

  • filter – What metrics to return with the response. Possible values are: titles, title_sentiments, mentions, summaries, sentiment_spans, urls. For more information check https://docs.stockgeist.ai.

  • start – Timestamp of the earliest data point in returned time series. Time is assumed to be in UTC time zone. Valid format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS.

  • end – Timestamp of the latest data point in returned time series. Time is assumed to be in UTC time zone. Valid format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS.

Returns

ArticleMetricsResponse object.

get_fundamentals(symbol: Optional[str] = None, filter: Tuple[str, ...] = ('market_cap')) → stockgeist.responses.FundamentalsResponse[source]¶

Queries StockGeist’s API and gets fundamentals data.

Parameters

  • symbol – Stock ticker for which to retrieve data.h, 1d.

  • filter – What metrics to return with the response. Possible values are: book_to_sh, rsi_14, eps_next_y, 52w_range, eps_ttm, roa, dividend_perc, beta, oper_margin, p_to_fcf, eps_this_y, inst_trans, p_to_b, rel_volume, perf_quarter, sales, roi, inst_own, index, perf_ytd, eps_next_q, avg_volume, dividend, p_to_c, insider_trans, short_float, country, income, perf_year, perf_half_y, atr, sales_past_5_y, 52w_high_diff, gross_margin, peg, perf_month, volatility, cash_to_sh, short_ratio, eps_past_5_y, debt_to_eq, sector, industry, eps_q_to_q, p_to_e, prev_close, volume, sma_20_diff, p_to_s, price, current_ratio, forward_p_to_e, sma_50_diff, employees, profit_margin, sma_200_diff, sales_q_to_q, earnings, perf_week, quick_ratio, payout, eps_next_5_y, recom, roe, shs_outstand, description, 52w_low_diff, company_name, target_price, market_cap, optionable, shortable, insider_own, shs_float, lt_debt_to_eq. For more information check https://docs.stockgeist.ai.

Returns

FundamentalsResponse object.

get_message_metrics(symbol: str, timeframe: str = '5m', filter: Tuple[str, ...] = ('total_count'), start: Optional[str] = None, end: Optional[str] = None) → stockgeist.responses.MessageMetricsResponse[source]¶

Queries StockGeist’s API and gets message metrics data.

Parameters

  • symbol – Stock ticker for which to retrieve data.

  • timeframe – Time resolution of returned data. Possible values are 5m, 1h, 1d.

  • filter – What metrics to return with the response. Possible values are: inf_positive_count, inf_neutral_count, inf_negative_count, inf_total_count, em_positive_count, em_neutral_count, em_negative_count, em_total_count, total_count, pos_index, msg_ratio, ma, ma_diff, std_dev, ma_count_change. For more information check https://docs.stockgeist.ai.

  • start – Timestamp of the earliest data point in returned time series. Time is assumed to be in UTC time zone. Valid format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS.

  • end – Timestamp of the latest data point in returned time series. Time is assumed to be in UTC time zone. Valid format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS.

Returns

MessageMetricsResponse object.

get_price_metrics(symbol: str, timeframe: str = '5m', filter: Tuple[str, ...] = ('close'), start: Optional[str] = None, end: Optional[str] = None) → stockgeist.responses.PriceMetricsResponse[source]¶

Queries StockGeist’s API and gets price metrics data.

Parameters

  • symbol – Stock ticker for which to retrieve data.

  • timeframe – Time resolution of returned data. Possible values are 5m, 1h, 1d.

  • filter – What metrics to return with the response. Possible values are: open, high, low, close, volume. For more information check https://docs.stockgeist.ai.

  • start – Timestamp of the earliest data point in returned time series. Time is assumed to be in UTC time zone. Valid format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS.

  • end – Timestamp of the latest data point in returned time series. Time is assumed to be in UTC time zone. Valid format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS.

Returns

PriceMetricsResponse object.

get_ranking_metrics(symbol: Optional[str] = None, timeframe: str = '5m', filter: Tuple[str, ...] = ('symbols'), start: Optional[str] = None, end: Optional[str] = None, by: str = 'total_count', direction: str = 'descending', top: int = 5) → stockgeist.responses.RankingMetricsResponse[source]¶

Queries StockGeist’s API and gets ranking metrics data.

Parameters

  • symbol – Stock ticker for which to retrieve data.

  • timeframe – Time resolution of returned data. Possible values are 5m, 1h, 1d.

  • filter – What metrics to return with the response. Possible values are: symbols, scores, score_changes, values. For more information check https://docs.stockgeist.ai.

  • start – Timestamp of the earliest data point in returned time series. Time is assumed to be in UTC time zone. Valid format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS.

  • end – Timestamp of the latest data point in returned time series. Time is assumed to be in UTC time zone. Valid format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS.

  • by – Select message metric by which stock ranking is produced. Possible values are: inf_positive_count, inf_neutral_count, inf_negative_count, inf_total_count, em_positive_count, em_neutral_count, em_negative_count, em_total_count, total_count, pos_index, msg_ratio, ma, ma_diff, std_dev, ma_count_change.

  • direction – Ranking direction: descending/ascending leaves stock with largest/smallest metric value at the top.

  • top – Number of top stocks to return.

Returns

RankingMetricsResponse object.

get_symbols() → stockgeist.responses.SymbolsResponse[source]¶

Queries StockGeist’s API and gets all available symbols.

Returns

SymbolsResponse object.

get_topic_metrics(symbol: str, timeframe: str = '5m', filter: Tuple[str, ...] = ('words'), start: Optional[str] = None, end: Optional[str] = None) → stockgeist.responses.TopicMetricsResponse[source]¶

Queries StockGeist’s API and gets topic metrics data.

Parameters

  • symbol – Stock ticker for which to retrieve data.

  • timeframe – Time resolution of returned data. Possible values are 5m, 1h, 1d.

  • filter – What metrics to return with the response. Possible values are: words, scores. For more information check https://docs.stockgeist.ai.

  • start – Timestamp of the earliest data point in returned time series. Time is assumed to be in UTC time zone. Valid format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS.

  • end – Timestamp of the latest data point in returned time series. Time is assumed to be in UTC time zone. Valid format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS.

Returns

TopicMetricsResponse object.

stockgeist.responses module¶

class stockgeist.responses.ArticleMetricsResponse(res: List[Dict], query_args: Dict)[source]¶

Bases: stockgeist.responses._Response

Object containing data received from the article-metrics endpoint of StockGeist’s API.

visualize(what: str = 'titles') → None[source]¶

Visualize selected metrics from the downloaded article metrics data. :param what: String with metrics joined by + signs.

static visualize_sentiment(summary: str, sentiment_spans: List[Dict]) → None[source]¶

Print specified summary text with positive-sentiment parts displayed as green and negative-sentiment parts as red. :param summary: Single summary string from downloaded article metrics data. :param sentiment_spans: Sentiment spans corresponding to specified summary string.

Visualize selected metrics from the downloaded price metrics data. :param what: String with metrics joined by + signs. :param display_candlesticks: Whether to display candlestick OHLCV chart (requires all corresponding metrics).
